result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:46 AM Cases called 21CF332 and 22CF56 - Defendant Alan Cameron Olson in court, in custody at Ozaukee County Jail.  Attorney Martin Russell Tanz in court for Alan Cameron Olson.  Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin. State has to bail conditions and WCS report in case 21CF332. Preliminary Hearing held for case 22CF56 - J. Brown Sanders sworn and testifies. States moves to bind matter over for trial, Counsel moves to dismiss. Court finds State has met their burden of proof. State files information. Counsel acknowledges receipt of information, waives reading and enters not guilty plea.
Further proceedings scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 11:30 am on 22CF56

Submit to SCRAM by 4:30 pm day of release  Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.   No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. Not to be in any liquor stores, bar, or any establishments whose sole purpose is the sale of alcohol.

Court advises of charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State recommends $2000 cash bail w/conditions. Counsel waives time limits requests status.
Status hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
